ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Provides some easy-to-use functions to extract and visualize the output of multivariate data analyses, including 'PCA' (Principal Component Analysis), 'CA' (Correspondence Analysis), 'MCA' (Multiple Correspondence Analysis), 'FAMD' (Factor Analysis of Mixed Data), 'MFA' (Multiple Factor Analysis) and 'HMFA' (Hierarchical Multiple Factor Analysis) functions from different R packages. It contains also functions for simplifying some clustering analysis steps and provides 'ggplot2' - based elegant data visualization.

Provides some easy-to-use functions to extract and visualize the output of multivariate data analyses, including 'PCA' (Principal Component Analysis), 'CA' (Correspondence Analysis), 'MCA' (Multiple Correspondence Analysis), 'FAMD' (Factor Analysis of Mixed Data), 'MFA' (Multiple Factor Analysis) and 'HMFA' (Hierarchical Multiple Factor Analysis) functions from different R packages. It contains also functions for simplifying some clustering analysis steps and provides 'ggplot2' - based elegant data visualization.

name: r-factoextra
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.0.7" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-factoextra
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/factoextra_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/factoextra/factoextra_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 624ff01c74933352aca55966f8a052b1ccc878f52c2c307e47f88e0665db94aa

build:
  number: 5
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-factominer
    - r-abind
    - r-cluster
    - r-dendextend
    - r-ggplot2 >=2.2.0
    - r-ggpubr >=0.1.5
    - r-ggrepel
    - r-reshape2
    - r-tidyr
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-factominer
    - r-abind
    - r-cluster
    - r-dendextend
    - r-ggplot2 >=2.2.0
    - r-ggpubr >=0.1.5
    - r-ggrepel
    - r-reshape2
    - r-tidyr

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('factoextra')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('factoextra')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=factoextra
  license: GPL-2.0-only
  summary: Provides some easy-to-use functions to extract and visualize the output of multivariate data analyses, including 'PCA' (Principal Component Analysis),
    'CA' (Correspondence Analysis), 'MCA' (Multiple Correspondence Analysis), 'FAMD' (Factor Analysis of Mixed Data), 'MFA' (Multiple Factor Analysis) and 'HMFA'
    (Hierarchical Multiple Factor Analysis) functions from different R packages. It contains also functions for simplifying some clustering analysis steps and provides
    'ggplot2' - based elegant data visualization.
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file: {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
